description: The Selection API controls and modifies user text selections within the page.
description_html: The Selection API controls and modifies user text selections within the page.
name: Selection

firefox.notes: Only supported for HTMLDocument, not all Document objects.

firefox_android.notes: Only supported for HTMLDocument, not all Document objects.

chrome.notes: Before Chrome 127, a selectionchange event was fired on Document, see Document's selectionchange event. See bug 40840956 for firing the event on <input> elements.

chrome_android.notes: Before Chrome Android 127, a selectionchange event was fired on Document, see Document's selectionchange event. See bug 40840956 for firing the event on <input> elements.

safari_ios.notes: Before Safari on iOS 18, a selectionchange event was fired on Document, see Document's selectionchange event. See bug 271033 for firing the event on <input> elements.

firefox.notes: Starting with Firefox 13, the Range object throws a DOMException as defined in DOM 4, instead of a RangeException defined in prior specifications.

firefox_android.notes: Starting with Firefox for Android 14, the Range object throws a DOMException as defined in DOM 4, instead of a RangeException defined in prior specifications.

chrome.notes: Starting in Chrome 37, this method is a no-op and has no effect.

chrome_android.notes: Starting in Chrome Android 37, this method is a no-op and has no effect.

firefox.notes: Starting in Firefox 15.0, this method is a no-op and has no effect.

firefox_android.notes: Starting in Firefox for Android 15.0, this method is a no-op and has no effect.

oculus.notes: Starting in Quest Browser 5.0, this method is a no-op and has no effect.

opera.notes: Starting in Opera 24, this method is a no-op and has no effect.

opera_android.notes: Starting in Opera 24, this method is a no-op and has no effect.

safari.notes: Starting in Safari 10, this method is a no-op and has no effect, see bug 148454.

safari_ios.notes: Starting in Safari on iOS 10, this method is a no-op and has no effect, see bug 148454.

samsunginternet_android.notes: Starting in Samsung Internet 3.0, this method is a no-op and has no effect.

webview_android.notes: Starting in WebView Android 37, this method is a no-op and has no effect.

webview_ios.notes: Starting in WebView on iOS 10, this method is a no-op and has no effect, see bug 148454.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 35, the method didn't throw if node was null.

firefox_android.notes: Before Firefox for Android 35, the method didn't throw if node was null.

firefox.notes: In Firefox, StaticRange can currently only be used by browser-internal code or code with enhanced permissions; it is not yet exposed to the web.
